  proposition: Oluwaseyi Feyisetan, Borja Balle, Thomas Drake, and Tom Diethe published a paper on privacy- and utility-preserving textual analysis.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Oluwaseyi Feyisetan|PUBLISHED|research paper
    Borja Balle|PUBLISHED|research paper
    Thomas Drake|PUBLISHED|research paper

  proposition: Satyapriya Krishna, Rahul Gupta, and Christophe Dupuy proposed ADePT: an auto-encoder based differentially private text transformation method.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    ADePT|TYPE|auto-encoder based differentially private text transformation method

    entity-entity relationships:
    Satyapriya Krishna|PROPOSED|ADePT
    Rahul Gupta|PROPOSED|ADePT
    Christophe Dupuy|PROPOSED|ADePT

  proposition: Yansong Li, Zhixing Tan, and Yang Liu developed a privacy-preserving prompt tuning approach for large language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    None

    entity-entity relationships:
    Yansong Li|DEVELOPED|privacy-preserving prompt tuning approach
    Zhixing Tan|DEVELOPED|privacy-preserving prompt tuning approach
    Yang Liu|DEVELOPED|privacy-preserving prompt tuning approach

  proposition: Ashwinee Panda, Tong Wu, Jiachen T. Wang, and Prateek Mittal researched privacy-preserving in-context learning for large language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    None

    entity-entity relationships:
    Ashwinee Panda|RESEARCHED|privacy-preserving in-context learning
    Tong Wu|RESEARCHED|privacy-preserving in-context learning
    Jiachen T. Wang|RESEARCHED|privacy-preserving in-context learning
    Prateek Mittal|RESEARCHED|privacy-preserving in-context learning

  proposition: Junyuan Hong and colleagues introduced DP-OPT, a method to make large language models privacy-preserving prompt engineers.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    DP-OPT|TYPE|method to make large language models privacy-preserving prompt engineers

    entity-entity relationships:
    Junyuan Hong|INTRODUCED|DP-OPT

  proposition: Xiaojin Zhang and team explored the "No Free Lunch" theorem for privacy-preserving LLM inference.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    None

    entity-entity relationships:
    Xiaojin Zhang|EXPLORED|"No Free Lunch" theorem

  proposition: Yiming Wang, Yu Lin, Xiaodong Zeng, and Guannan Zhang developed PrivateLoRA for efficient privacy-preserving language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    PrivateLoRA|TYPE|efficient privacy-preserving language model method

    entity-entity relationships:
    Yiming Wang|DEVELOPED|PrivateLoRA
    Yu Lin|DEVELOPED|PrivateLoRA
    Xiaodong Zeng|DEVELOPED|PrivateLoRA
    Guannan Zhang|DEVELOPED|PrivateLoRA

  proposition: Mishaal Kazmi and colleagues created PANORAMIA, a privacy auditing method for machine learning models without retraining.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    PANORAMIA|TYPE|privacy auditing method for machine learning models without retraining

    entity-entity relationships:
    Mishaal Kazmi|CREATED|PANORAMIA

  proposition: Haoran Li and team developed PrivLM-Bench, a multi-level privacy evaluation benchmark for language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    PrivLM-Bench|TYPE|multi-level privacy evaluation benchmark for language models

    entity-entity relationships:
    Haoran Li|DEVELOPED|PrivLM-Bench

  proposition: Qinbin Li and researchers proposed LLM-PBE for assessing data privacy in large language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    LLM-PBE|TYPE|method for assessing data privacy in large language models

    entity-entity relationships:
    Qinbin Li|PROPOSED|LLM-PBE

  proposition: Sonu Gupta and colleagues created and analyzed an international corpus of privacy laws.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    None

    entity-entity relationships:
    Sonu Gupta|CREATED|international corpus of privacy laws
    Sonu Gupta|ANALYZED|international corpus of privacy laws
